meanings.definition: A name that describes someone's position or job.
meanings.sent1: Her title at work is manager.
meanings.sent2: The title on his business card reads 'Director'.
meanings.sent3: The title 'Queen Bee' suits her well in the office.
meanings.sent4: She wears the title of 'team leader' with pride.
meanings.sent5: The title 'CEO' carries a sense of authority and responsibility.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase that is used to identify a book, movie, or other work.
meanings.sent1: The title of the book is 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer'.
meanings.sent2: What is the title of the latest Marvel movie?
meanings.sent3: The title 'Gone with the Wind' makes me think of a windy day.
meanings.sent4: The title 'The Great Gatsby' hints at a grand story.
meanings.sent5: The title 'Jurassic Park' evokes images of dinosaurs and adventure.

meanings.definition: The legal right to own property or a piece of land.
meanings.sent1: He has the title deed to his house.
meanings.sent2: The title to the land was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cat had the title to the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The title to the beachfront property was highly sought after.
meanings.sent5: The title to the estate came with a lot of responsibilities.
